    • Method Detail

      • tupleStream

        public static <T> Stream<T[]> tupleStream(int characteristics,
                                          boolean isParallel,
                                          Stream<? extends T>... streams)

        Returns a stream of tuples built from base streams, by populating each tuple item with one item from the underlining streams. This is basically a wrapper of TupleSpliterator, made by means of Spliterators.spliteratorUnknownSize(Iterator, int) and StreamSupport.stream(Spliterator, boolean).

        Parameters:
        characteristics - this is passed to Spliterators.spliteratorUnknownSize(Iterator, int), Spliterator.IMMUTABLE is always OR-ed to whatever value you pass here, since the underlining tuple iterator is read-only.
        isParallel - this is passed to StreamSupport.stream(Spliterator, boolean), since the underlining iterator is immutable, creating a parallel stream as result shouldn’t be a problem, unless you’ve some strange things in the base streams.
        streams - the base streams from which the result is built.
        See Also:
        unit tests for examples of usage.

      • tupleStream

        public static <T> Stream<T[]> tupleStream(Stream<? extends T>... streams)

        Defaults to 0 (which implies Spliterator.IMMUTABLE only) and false (i.e., non-parallel result stream).
